description.narrative: NAMA FOR IWM & BIOGAS as Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions for Integrated Waste Management and Biogas in Uganda project.

participating-org.narrative: UGA Min of Energy and Min Devt

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Project objectives
Indicator 1: Amount (in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2eq/yr) Indicator 2: Number of people benefitting from improved organic waste management Indicator 3: Amount of Financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based biogas energy systems (US$) Indicator 4: Annual volume of electric energy produced by biogas pilots (MWh/yr).
Output 1
1.1. Number of policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted (#) 1.2. Number of municipalities (#) reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities 1.3. Multi-stakeholder platform established.
Output 2
2.1. Multi-stakeholder platform established 2.2. Number of investments undertaken 2.3. Electricity generating capacity of MSW-based biogas pilot projects (MW) Output 3
Indicator 1: Amount (in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2eq/yr) Indicator 2: Number of people benefitting from improved organic waste management Indicator 3: Amount of Financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based biogas energy systems (US$) Indicator 4: Annual volume of electric energy produced by biogas pilots (MWh/yr) Number of policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted (#) Number of municipalities (#) reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities
Output 1:
1.1. Multi-stakeholder platform established (in line with UNDP Country Programme Output indicator: 3.1.3.1: No. of functional platforms established to engage citizens at all levels for sustainable environment and natural resources, disaggregated by category)
Output 2
2.1. Electricity generating capacity of MSW-based biogas pilot projects (MW) 2.2. Number of investments undertaken
Output 3 3.1. Grant/technical assistance fund and approach to attract investment into MSW-based biogas sector established 3.2. Number of MSW-based biogas pr

comment.narrative:
Objectives
Baseline 1: Zero(in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2eq/yr) Indicator 2: Number of people benefitting from improved organic waste management (TBD) Indicator 3: Zero of Financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based biogas energy systems (US$) Indicator 4: No Annual volume of electric energy produced by biogas pilots (MWh/yr) Zero of policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted (#) Number of municipalities (#) reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities (TBD).
Output 1:
1.1. Multi-stakeholder platform established TBD (in line with UNDP Country Programme Output indicator: 3.1.3.1: No. of functional platforms established to engage citizens at all levels for sustainable environment and natural resources, disaggregated by category)
Output 2
2.1. Zero MW Electricity generating capacity of MSW-based biogas pilot projects (MW) 2.2. Number of investments undertaken (TBD)
Output 3 No Grant/technical assistance fund and approach to attract investment into MSW-based biogas sector established Zero MSW-based biogas project concepts prepared (#) Zero amount of Grants in USD disbursed from the fund (either technical assistance or investment)
Output 4 No existence of a functional project website Zero Knowledge Management products developed and disseminated (#) No standardised baselines for calculating emissions reductions in place NAMA registered on the UNFCCC Registry

Output 1 Enhanced capacity of municipalities to develop waste management plans and manage municipal solid waste and wastewater in a more sustainable manner
1.1. Number of policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted (#) 1.2. Number of municipalities (#) reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities 1.3. Multi-stakeholder platform established.
Output 2 Biogas and WWT plants using MSW feedstock and sewage sludge procured and fully operational.
2.1. Feasibility studies for three biogas demonstration sites, prepare necessary permitting procedures for the selected sites and present final engineering plans for the selected biogas plant sites to be executed and formalization of responsibilities of project partners (80% payment for NWSC and KCCA respectively 2.2. Number of investments undertaken 2.3. Electricity generating capacity of MSW-based biogas pilot projects (MW)
Output 3:Biogas technology replicated in other potential municipalities with the help of a grant and technical assistance fund .Output 4: Lessons learnt and success of the demonstration projects supports replication and scaling-up of project results 4.1 Develop standardised baselines for calculating Emissions reductions from Biogas

1.1.5 National Solid Waste Management Policy was revised to include waste to energy aspects. 1.2.1 At least 15 technical personnel and champions from the four pilot cities of Jinja, Masaka, Mbale and Mbarara were sensitized on integrated waste management approaches through visiting successful cases/sites in KCCA and NWSC. 1.2.2 Waste management plans and waste management ordinances for the Cities of Arua, Hoima, Soroti, Gulu, Lira,Fortportal and Municipalities of Tororo, Masindi, Kabale were reviewed. 1.2.3 Three (3) ordinances i.e for Mbale, jinja and Masaka were submitted to the Solicitor General’s Office for final review 1.3.1 A multi-stakeholder platform for waste management and energy recovery was established . 2.1.1.Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) and feasibility report for KCCA were completed and submitted to NEMA and the Ministry respectively in December 2021 3.1.1 A gender Strategy and Action Plan was developed for the project 4.3.2 Data was obtained for computation of standard baselines from stakeholders i.e sugarcane factories and NWSC on the Municipal wastewater plants

Objectives
Target 1: Zero(in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot Biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2 Eq/yr) Target 2: Number of people benefiting from improved organic waste management (TBD) Target 3: Zero of Financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based Biogas energy systems (US$) Target 4: No Annual volume of electric energy produced by Biogas pilots (MWh/yr) Target 5: Zero number of policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted. Target 6: Zero number of municipalities (#) reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities.
Output 1:
Multi-stakeholder platform established TBD (in line with UNDP Country Programme Output indicator: 3.1.3.1: No. of functional platforms established to engage citizens at all levels for sustainable environment and natural resources, disaggregated by category)
Output 2
Zero MW Electricity generating capacity of MSW-based biogas pilot projects (MW) Zero number of investments undertaken.
Output 3 No Grant/technical assistance fund and approach to attract investment into MSW-based biogas sector established Zero MSW-based biogas project concepts prepared Zero amount of Grants in USD disbursed from the fund (either technical assistance or investment)
Output 4 No existence of a functional project website Zero number of Knowledge Management products developed and disseminated No standardized baselines for calculating emissions reductions in place NAMA registered on the UNFCCC Registry

Objectives
Result 1: Zero(in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot Biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2 eq/yr) Result 2: Number of people benefiting from improved organic waste management (TBD) Result 3: Zero amount of financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based Biogas energy systems (US$) Result 4: No Annual volume of electric energy produced by biogas pilots (MWh/Yr) Zero policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted. Two municipalities, Mbale and Masaka have increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities.
Output 1:
1.1. 05 waste management plans and ordinances/byelaws for 4 Municipalities of Masaka, Jinja, Mbale and Mbarara. 1.2. 02 municipalities reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities. 1.3. No consortium of waste management players/actors from 4 municipalities who will be part of the multi-stakeholder platform. Output 2
2.1. 00MW Electricity generating capacity of MSW-based Biogas pilot projects (MW) 2.2. 00 investments undertaken.
Output 3 3.1. No Grant/technical assistance fund and approach to attract investment into MSW-based Biogas sector established. 3.2. 00 MSW-based Biogas project concepts prepared. 3.3. 00 Grants in USD disbursed from the fund (either technical assistance or investment).
Output 4 4.1. A functional project website in place. 4.2. Knowledge Management products developed and disseminated during the Project Board meeting held on 27th Nov 2020 . 4.3. No standardized baselines for calculating emissions reductions in place but TOR finalized for advertisement 4.4. NAMA registered on the UNFCCC Registry.

Objectives
Target 1: Zero(in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot Biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2 Eq/Yr) Target 2: 00f people benefiting from improved organic waste management (TBD) Target 3: 00 amount of financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based Biogas energy systems (US$) Target 4: No Annual volume of electric energy produced by Biogas pilots (MWh/Yr) Target 5: 10 policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted. Target 6: 04municipalities (#) reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities.
Output 1:
1.1. Updated waste management plans and ordinances/byelaws for 4 Municipalities of Masaka, Jinja, Mbale and Mbarara. 1.2. 4 municipalities reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities. 1.3. Established a consortium of waste management players/actors from 4 municipalities who will be part of the multi-stakeholder platform.
Output 2 2.1. 2.9 MW of electricity generating pilot scale biogas plants of capacity set up.
2.2. Investments for 3 pilot scale biogas plants undertaken
Output 3 3.1.Preliminary grant/technical assistance fund and approach to attract investment into MSW-based biogas sector established.
3.2. MSW-based biogas project concepts prepared.
Output 4 4.1.Have a functional project website. 4.2. Knowledge products developed and disseminated (brochures, sensitization material etc.). 4.3. Standardized baselines for calculating emissions reductions from NAMA projects in place. 4.4. NAMA project registered on the UNFCCC Registry.

Result 1: Zero (in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot Biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2 eq/yr) Result 2: Number of people benefiting from improved organic waste management (TBD) Result 3: Zero amount of financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based Biogas energy systems (US$) Result 4: No Annual volume of electric energy produced by biogas pilots (MWh/Yr) Result 5: Zero policy and regulatory proposals developed and adopted. Result 6: Two municipalities, Mbale and Masaka have increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities.
Indicator 1: Zero (0) Amount (in tonnage) of GHG emission reductions by pilot biogas energy plants and replication (ton CO2eq/yr)- (0)
Indicator 2: 398 people have benefited from activities of project related to training and sensitization on improved organic waste management.
Indicator 3: Amount of Financing mobilized for investment in MSW-based biogas energy systems (US$) (0)
Indicator 4: Annual volume of electric energy produced by biogas pilots (MWh/yr) (2,800 MWh/Yr) Kakira Sugar Works
Output 1:
1.1. 05 waste management plans and ordinances/byelaws for 5 Cities of Kampala, Masaka, Jinja, Mbale and Mbarara. 1.2. 04 Cities reporting increased capacity to undertake IWM, as a result of the projects capacity development activities. 1.3. A consortium of waste management players/actors consisting of 50 persons from 5 Cities who will be part of the multi-stakeholder platform has been formed.
Output 2
2.1. 0.4MW Electricity generating capacity of MSW-based Biogas pilot projects Kakira Sugar Works 2.2. 00 investments undertaken.
Output 3 3.1. No Grant/technical assistance fund and approach to attract investment into MSW-based Biogas sector established. 3.2. 00 MSW-based Biogas project concepts prepared. 3.3. 00 Grants in USD disbursed from the fund (either technical assistance or investment).
Output 4 4.1. A functional project website in place. 4.2. Knowledge Management products developed and disseminated. 4.3. No standardized baselines for calculating emissions reductions in place. 4.4. NAMA registered on the UNFCCC Registry.
